page.title: 01REVIEW OF THE AREA
page.content: The 12km. squares lie to the east of the small town of{Dronfield, in N.E. Derbyshire. The area forms part of the Green Belt between the city of{Sheffield, whose boundary is adjacent to the northern edge of the area, and the town of{Chesterfield}whose boundary lies 2km. to the south. Although relatively new housing development and light industry of Dronfield occupies the western edge, the area is predominantly rural. The upper Moss valley covers the greater portion of the area together with part of the eastern side of the Drone valley. The largest rural settlement in the area is the village of { {Apperknowle}.
